title: Authors and Citation

title: Authors and Citation
text: Semião R (2023). varutils: Utility Functions VAR Analisys. R package version 0.1.0,  https://ricardo-semiao.github.io/varutils/, https://https://github.com/ricardo-semiao/varutils.
code: @Manual{,   title = {varutils: Utility Functions for VAR Analisys},   author = {Ricardo Semião},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.1.0,  https://ricardo-semiao.github.io/varutils/},   url = {https://https://github.com/ricardo-semiao/varutils}, }

title: Utility Functions for VAR Analisys
text: varutils R package developed provide general utility functions projects involving Vector Auto-Regressive models, specifically vars package. Mainly, functions retrieve results vars objects, manipulate tidyverse, plot commonly needed ggplot graphs, realm IRF’s, FEVD’s, predict graphs, VAR series residual analysis. future, intent add functions quick (thorough) analysis retrieval trends, seasonality, structural breaks, using common methods statistical tests. Additionally, want expand package VAR-like objects. Disclaimer: package constant development, early stage life. hasn’t thoroughly tested can present several bugs. Please report problems email () github issue. Thank attention. Author: Ricardo Semião e Castro (ricardo.semiao@outlook)

title: Utility Functions for VAR Analisys
text: can install development version varutils GitHub :
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("ricardo-semiao/varutils")

what: Plot Autocorrelation (and Similars) of Dataset — ggvar_acf
title: Plot Autocorrelation (and Similars) of Dataset — ggvar_acf
text: ggvar_acf plots result acf call every series, using ggplot facet_wrap. ggvar_ccf plots cross correlations (similars) series, using ggplot matrix fashion facet_grid.

title: Plot Autocorrelation (and Similars) of Dataset — ggvar_acf
code: ggvar_acf(   x,   series = NULL,   type = "correlation",   lag.max = NULL,   ci = 0.95,   geom = "segment",   palette = c("black", "black", "blue", NA),   scales = "fixed",   ncol = 1,   ... )  ggvar_ccf(   x,   series = NULL,   type = "correlation",   lag.max = NULL,   ci = 0.95,   facet = "ggplot",   geom = "segment",   palette = c("black", "black", "blue", NA),   scales = "fixed",   independent = "y",   ... )

title: Plot Autocorrelation (and Similars) of Dataset — ggvar_acf
text: x dataset (object coercible data.frame) "varest" object get residuals . series character vector variables consider. Defaults (NULL). type type ACF computed, passed acf. Can either "correlation", "covariance", "partial". lag.max number lags used calculate ACF, passed acf. defaults ceiling(10 * log(nrow(data) / ncol(data), base = 10)). ci level confidence ACF confidence interval. Set FALSE omit. geom ggplot geom used create plot, "segment" geom_segment (default) "area" geom_area. palette vector colors (bins, normal curve). See vignette("palettes"). scales "fixed" (default), "free", "free_x" "free_y". passed facet_wrap. ncol integer. number facet columns, passed facet_wrap. ... Additional arguments passed ggplot geom defined geom. facet facet "engine" used. "ggplot2" facet_grid, "ggh4x" facet_grid2. independent varying scales cell. See facet_grid2.

title: Plot Autocorrelation (and Similars) of Dataset — ggvar_acf
text: object class ggplot.

title: Plot Autocorrelation (and Similars) of Dataset — ggvar_acf
code: ggvar_acf(EuStockMarkets)  ggvar_ccf(EuStockMarkets)  ggvar_acf(vars::VAR(EuStockMarkets))

title: Plot VAR Residuals Dispersion — ggvar_dispersion
text: Plots scatterplot residuals versus fitted values VAR model, using ggplot2.

title: Plot VAR Residuals Dispersion — ggvar_dispersion
code: ggvar_dispersion(   x,   series = NULL,   palette = c("black", "black"),   scales = "fixed",   ncol = 1,   alpha = 0.5,   ... )

title: Plot VAR Residuals Dispersion — ggvar_dispersion
text: x "varest" object get residuals fitted values . series character vector variables consider. Defaults (NULL). palette vector colors (points, x-axis line). See vignette("palettes"). scales "fixed" (default), "free", "free_x" "free_y". passed facet_wrap. ncol integer. number facet columns, passed facet_wrap. alpha double. alpha aesthetic points, passed geom_point. ... Additional arguments passed geom_point.

title: Plot VAR Residuals Dispersion — ggvar_dispersion
text: object class ggplot.

title: Plot VAR Residuals Dispersion — ggvar_dispersion
code: ggvar_dispersion(vars::VAR(EuStockMarkets))

title: Plot VAR Residuals Distribution — ggvar_distribution
text: Plots histogram residuals VAR model, variables dataset, overlapped normal curve.

title: Plot VAR Residuals Distribution — ggvar_distribution
code: ggvar_distribution(   x,   series = NULL,   plot_normal = TRUE,   palette = c("grey", "black"),   bins = 30,   size = 1,   ... )

title: Plot VAR Residuals Distribution — ggvar_distribution
text: x Either "varest" object plotting residuals, dataset (object coercible data.frame) numeric variables. series character vector variables consider. Defaults (NULL). plot_normal Logical, whether normal curve plotted. palette vector colors (bins, normal curve). See vignette("palettes"). bins integer. number histogram bins, passed geom_histogram. size integer. size normal curve line, passed geom_line. ... Additional arguments passed geom_histogram.

title: Plot VAR Residuals Distribution — ggvar_distribution
text: object class ggplot.

title: Plot VAR Residuals Distribution — ggvar_distribution
code: ggvar_distribution(vars::VAR(EuStockMarkets))

what: Plot for Forecast Error Variance Decomposition of a VAR — ggvar_fevd
title: Plot for Forecast Error Variance Decomposition of a VAR — ggvar_fevd
text: Plots result fevd call.

title: Plot for Forecast Error Variance Decomposition of a VAR — ggvar_fevd
code: ggvar_fevd(   x,   n.ahead = NULL,   series = NULL,   geom = "bar",   palette = NULL,   scales = "fixed",   ncol = 1,   ... )

title: Plot for Forecast Error Variance Decomposition of a VAR — ggvar_fevd
text: x "varest" object pass fevd, , directly, "varfevd" object. n.ahead integer. size forecast horizon, passed fevd. Unused `x` "varfevd". series character vector variables consider. Defaults (NULL). geom ggplot geom used create plot, "bar" geom_bar (default), "area" geom_area, "line" geom_line. palette vector colors (line, conf. interval). See vignette("palettes"). scales "fixed" (default), "free", "free_x" "free_y". passed facet_wrap. ncol integer. number facet columns, passed facet_wrap. ... Additional arguments passed ggplot geom defined geom.

title: Plot for Forecast Error Variance Decomposition of a VAR — ggvar_fevd
text: object class ggplot.

title: Plot for Forecast Error Variance Decomposition of a VAR — ggvar_fevd
code: ggvar_fevd(vars::VAR(EuStockMarkets), n.ahead = 10)

title: Plot VAR Fitted Values — ggvar_fit
text: Plots fitted values VAR model, versus actual values. ggvar_fit Plots series facet. ggvar_fit_colored plots graph, different color.

title: Plot VAR Fitted Values — ggvar_fit
code: ggvar_fit(   x,   compare = TRUE,   series = NULL,   index = 1:x$totobs,   palette = c("black"),   linetypes = c("solid", "dashed"),   scales = "fixed",   ncol = 1,   ... )  ggvar_fit_colored(   x,   compare = TRUE,   series = NULL,   index = 1:x$obs,   palette = NULL,   linetypes = c("solid", "dashed"),   ... )

title: Plot VAR Fitted Values — ggvar_fit
text: x "varest" object get fitted values . compare Logical, true values printed? series character vector variables consider. Defaults (NULL). index vector labels x-axis, normally dates. Must length equal x$obs. Defaults numeric sequence. palette vector colors. Just one ggvar_fit, one variable ggvar_fit_colored. See vignette("palettes"). linetypes vector line types (fitted, original), passed scale_linetype_manual. scales "fixed" (default), "free", "free_x" "free_y". passed facet_wrap. ncol integer. number facet columns, passed facet_wrap. ... Additional arguments passed geom_line.

title: Plot VAR Fitted Values — ggvar_fit
text: object class ggplot.

title: Plot VAR Fitted Values — ggvar_fit
code: x <- vars::VAR(EuStockMarkets) ggvar_fit(x, index = stats::time(EuStockMarkets))  ggvar_fit_colored(x, index = stats::time(EuStockMarkets))

what: Plot Impulse Response Functions of a VAR — ggvar_irf
title: Plot Impulse Response Functions of a VAR — ggvar_irf
text: Plots result irf call.

title: Plot Impulse Response Functions of a VAR — ggvar_irf
code: ggvar_irf(   x,   n.ahead = NULL,   series_impulse = NULL,   series_response = NULL,   facet = "ggplot",   ci = 0.95,   ...,   palette = c("black", "blue", "gray"),   scales = "fixed",   independent = "y" )

title: Plot Impulse Response Functions of a VAR — ggvar_irf
text: x "varest" object pass irf, , directly, "varirf" object. n.ahead integer. size forecast horizon, passed irf. Unused `x` "varirf". series_impulse character vector variables consider impulses. Defaults (NULL). series_response character vector variables consider responses. Defaults (NULL). facet facet "engine" used. "ggplot2" facet_grid, "ggh4x" facet_grid2. ci level confidence irf. Set FALSE omit. ... arguments passed irf. palette vector colors (bins, normal curve). See vignette("palettes"). scales "fixed" (default), "free", "free_x" "free_y". passed facet_wrap. independent varying scales cell. See facet_grid2.

title: Plot Impulse Response Functions of a VAR — ggvar_irf
text: object class ggplot.

title: Plot Impulse Response Functions of a VAR — ggvar_irf
code: ggvar_irf(vars::VAR(EuStockMarkets), n.ahead = 10)

what: Plot the Predicted Values of a VAR — ggvar_predict
title: Plot the Predicted Values of a VAR — ggvar_predict
text: Plots result predict.varest call. option overlay true variables, provided test dataset.

title: Plot the Predicted Values of a VAR — ggvar_predict
code: ggvar_predict(   x,   data_test = NULL,   n.ahead = nrow(data_test),   series = NULL,   index = 1:n.ahead,   palette = c("blue", "black", "darkblue", "gray"),   linetypes = "dashed",   alpha = 0.8,   scales = "fixed",   ncol = 1,   ... )

title: Plot the Predicted Values of a VAR — ggvar_predict
text: x "varest" object get predictions , , directly, "varprd" object. data_test test data set (object coercible data.frame), actual series values. n.ahead integer. number periods predict, passed predict. Defaults nrow(data_test) horizon "varprd" object. series character vector variables consider. Defaults (NULL). index vector labels x-axis, normally dates. Must length equal n.ahead. Defaults numeric sequence. palette vector colors. Just one ggvar_fit, one variable ggvar_fit_colored. See vignette("palettes"). linetypes line types geom_ribbon. alpha double. alpha aesthetic fill geom_ribbon. scales "fixed" (default), "free", "free_x" "free_y". passed facet_wrap. ncol integer. number facet columns, passed facet_wrap. ... Additional arguments passed geom_line.

title: Plot the Predicted Values of a VAR — ggvar_predict
text: object class ggplot.

title: Plot the Predicted Values of a VAR — ggvar_predict
code: ggvar_predict(vars::VAR(EuStockMarkets), n.ahead = 10)  ggvar_predict(vars::VAR(EuStockMarkets[1:1800,]), EuStockMarkets[1801:1860,]) #> Warning: `n.ahead` suplied with non NULL `data_test` was set to `nrow(data_test)`

what: Plot for Structural Stability of a VAR — ggvar_stability
title: Plot for Structural Stability of a VAR — ggvar_stability
text: Plots result stability call. Confidence intevals calculated using boundary.

title: Plot for Structural Stability of a VAR — ggvar_stability
code: ggvar_stability(   x,   series = NULL,   ci = 0.95,   ...,   palette = c("black", "blue"),   scales = "fixed",   ncol = 1 )

title: Plot for Structural Stability of a VAR — ggvar_stability
text: x "varest" object pass stability, , directly, "varstabil" object. series character vector variables consider. Defaults (NULL). ci level confidence boundary. ... arguments passed boundary. palette vector colors (line, conf. interval). See vignette("palettes"). scales "fixed" (default), "free", "free_x" "free_y". passed facet_wrap. ncol integer. number facet columns, passed facet_wrap.

title: Plot for Structural Stability of a VAR — ggvar_stability
text: object class ggplot.

title: Plot for Structural Stability of a VAR — ggvar_stability
code: ggvar_stability(vars::VAR(EuStockMarkets))

what: Plot Values of Dataset or VAR Residuals — ggvar_values
title: Plot Values of Dataset or VAR Residuals — ggvar_values
text: Plots historic values variables dataset, residuals VAR model. ggvar_values Plots series facet. ggvar_values_colored plots graph, different color.

title: Plot Values of Dataset or VAR Residuals — ggvar_values
code: ggvar_values(   x,   series = NULL,   index = NULL,   palette = c("black"),   scales = "fixed",   ncol = 1,   ... )  ggvar_values_colored(x, series = NULL, index = NULL, palette = NULL, ...)

title: Plot Values of Dataset or VAR Residuals — ggvar_values
text: x Either "varest" object plotting residuals, dataset (object coercible data.frame) numeric variables. series character vector variables consider. Defaults (NULL). index vector labels x-axis, normally dates. Must length equal x$obs nrow(x). Defaults numeric sequence. palette vector colors. Just one ggvar_values, one variable ggvar_values_colored. See vignette("palettes"). scales "fixed" (default), "free", "free_x" "free_y". passed facet_wrap. ncol integer. number facet columns, passed facet_wrap. ... Additional arguments passed geom_line.

title: Plot Values of Dataset or VAR Residuals — ggvar_values
text: object class ggplot.

title: Plot Values of Dataset or VAR Residuals — ggvar_values
code: ggvar_values(EuStockMarkets)  ggvar_values_colored(EuStockMarkets)  ggvar_values(vars::VAR(EuStockMarkets))

what: varutils: Utility Functions for VAR Analisys — varutils-package
title: varutils: Utility Functions for VAR Analisys — varutils-package
text: Functions commonly needed ggplot graphs Vector Auto-Regressive models, like IRF's, FEVD's, predict graphs, VAR residual analysis. Soon contain functions common tests statistics, VAR-like objects.
